etymologies: late 15th century: from Old French doulcemer, probably from Latin dulce melos ‘sweet melody’

definitions: a musical instrument with a sounding board or box, typically trapezoidal in shape, over which strings of graduated length are stretched, played by being struck with handheld hammers.
shortDefinitions: musical instrument with sounding board over which strings are stretched, played by plucking

definitions: a musical instrument with a long rounded body and a fretted fingerboard, played by bowing, plucking, and strumming.
shortDefinitions: musical instrument with long rounded body and fretted fingerboard
